text.div:
CancerDisorderPresent Profile

The presence of malignant neoplastic disease, in which abnormal cells divide without control and can invade nearby tissues.

Mapping Summary

oncocore.CancerDisorderPresent maps to http://fhir.org/guides/argonaut/StructureDefinition/argo-condition:
  _Entry.EntryId maps to id
  Language maps to language
  Narrative maps to text
  ImplicitRules maps to implicitRules
  Metadata.VersionId maps to meta.versionId
  Metadata.LastUpdated maps to meta.lastUpdated
  Metadata.SecurityLabel maps to meta.security
  Metadata.Tag maps to meta.tag
  Identifier maps to identifier
  CreationDate maps to dateRecorded
  Asserter maps to asserter
  Patient maps to patient
  Category maps to category
  Code maps to code
  BodySite.BodySiteCode maps to bodySite
  BodySite.Laterality maps to bodySite.extension
  BodySite.AnatomicalDirection maps to bodySite.extension
  BodySite.CommentOrDescription maps to bodySite.extension
  BodySite.Media maps to bodySite.extension
  BodySite.DistanceFromLandmark maps to bodySite.extension
  Encounter maps to encounter
  ClinicalStatus maps to clinicalStatus
  Status maps to verificationStatus
  Onset maps to onset[x]
  Abatement maps to abatement[x]
  Severity maps to severity
  StageInformation maps to stage
  StageInformation.StageSummary maps to stage.summary
  StageInformation.StageDetail maps to stage.assessment

name: CancerDisorderPresent
description: The presence of malignant neoplastic disease, in which abnormal cells divide without control and can invade nearby tissues.

element.name: argoprofile
element.definition: The presence of malignant neoplastic disease, in which abnormal cells divide without control and can invade nearby tissues.

constraint.human: Condition.clinicalStatus SHALL be present if verificationStatus is not entered-in-error. Condition.clinicalStatus SHALL NOT be present if verification Status is entered-in-error

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.id
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.meta
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.name: Condition.meta.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.name: Condition.meta.extension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Condition.meta.versionId
element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This values changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comments: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

element.name: Condition.meta.lastUpdated
element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comments: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant.

element.name: Condition.meta.profile
element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles [[[StructureDefinition]]]s that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [[[StructureDefinition.url]]].
element.comments: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time.  The list of profile URLs is a set.

element.name: Condition.meta.security
element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comments: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource  The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

element.name: Condition.meta.tag
element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comments: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.  The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

binding.description: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones"

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.implicitRules
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.language
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.text
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.contained
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.extension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: recorder
element.definition: The recorder of the information, if other than the information originator. For example, the nurse taking a list of medications reported by the patient.

element.name: datavalue
element.definition: The value or result of a test, evaluation, or judgment, for example, a systolic blood pressure, or if a condition or body structure is present or absent.

element.name: Condition.extension.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.name: extension
element.definition: An Extension

element.name: Condition.extension.url
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

element.name: Condition.extension.value[x]
element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.name: evidence
element.definition: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.

element.name: morphologybehavior
element.definition: A description of the morphology and behavioral characteristics of the cancer.

element.name: Condition.extension.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.name: extension
element.definition: An Extension

element.name: Condition.extension.url
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

element.name: Condition.extension.valueCodeableConcept
element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.modifierExtension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.identifier
element.definition: This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
element.requirements: Need to allow connection to a wider workflow.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.patient
element.definition: Indicates the patient who the condition record is associated with.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.encounter
element.definition: Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.
element.comments: This record indicates the encounter this particular record is associated with.  In the case of a "new" diagnosis reflecting ongoing/revised information about the condition, this might be distinct from the first encounter in which the underlying condition was first "known".

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.asserter
element.definition: Individual who is making the condition statement.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.dateRecorded
element.definition: A date, when  the Condition statement was documented.
element.comments: The Date Recorded represents the date when this particular Condition record was created in the EHR, not the date of the most recent update in terms of when severity, abatement, etc. were specified.  The date of the last record modification can be retrieved from the resource metadata.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.code
element.short: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis
element.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.category
element.definition: A category assigned to the condition.
element.comments: The categorization is often highly contextual and may appear poorly differentiated or not very useful in other contexts.

mapping.map: 'problem' if from PRB-3. 'diagnosis' if from DG1 segment in PV1 message

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.clinicalStatus
element.definition: The clinical status of the condition.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.verificationStatus
element.short: provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

mapping.map: .code (pre or post-coordinated in)  Can use valueNegationInd for refuted

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.severity
element.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
element.comments: Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

binding.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

mapping.map: Can be pre/post-coordinated into value.  Or ./inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="severity"].value

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.onset[x]
element.short: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
element.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.
element.comments: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition began to occur.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.abatement[x]
element.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.
element.comments: There is no explicit distinction between resolution and remission because in many cases the distinction is not clear. Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition abated.  If there is no abatement element, it is unknown whether the condition has resolved or entered remission; applications and users should generally assume that the condition is still valid.

mapping.map: .effectiveTime.high or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="age at remission"].value or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ]source[classCode=CONC, moodCode=EVN].status=completed

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.stage
element.definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

constraint.human: Stage SHALL have summary or assessment

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.stage.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.stage.extension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.stage.modifierExtension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.stage.summary
element.definition: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

binding.description: Codes describing condition stages (e.g. Cancer stages).

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.stage.assessment
element.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.evidence
element.definition: Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed.
element.comments: The evidence may be a simple list of coded symptoms/manifestations, or references to observations or formal assessments, or both.

constraint.human: evidence SHALL have code or details

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.evidence.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.evidence.extension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.evidence.modifierExtension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.evidence.code
element.definition: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

binding.description: Codes that describe the manifestation or symptoms of a condition.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.evidence.detail
element.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.bodySite
element.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.
element.comments: May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

element.name: Condition.bodySite.id
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.name: Condition.bodySite.extension
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: laterality
element.definition: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.

element.name: anatomicaldirection
element.definition: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.

element.name: commentordescription
element.definition: A text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization.

element.name: media
element.definition: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.

element.name: distancefromlandmark
element.definition: How far the anatomical location of interest is from the given landmark

element.name: Condition.bodySite.coding
element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comments: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labelled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for translations and alternate encodings within a code system.  Also supports communication of the same instance to systems requiring different encodings.

element.name: Condition.bodySite.text
element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comments: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.name: Condition:argoprofile.notes
element.definition: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

element.name: Condition
element.definition: The presence of malignant neoplastic disease, in which abnormal cells divide without control and can invade nearby tissues.

element.name: recorder
element.definition: The recorder of the information, if other than the information originator. For example, the nurse taking a list of medications reported by the patient.

element.name: datavalue
element.definition: The value or result of a test, evaluation, or judgment, for example, a systolic blood pressure, or if a condition or body structure is present or absent.

element.name: evidence
element.definition: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.

element.name: morphologybehavior
element.definition: A description of the morphology and behavioral characteristics of the cancer.

binding.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

element.name: laterality
element.definition: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.

element.name: anatomicaldirection
element.definition: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.

element.definition: A text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization.

element.name: media
element.definition: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.

element.name: distancefromlandmark
element.definition: How far the anatomical location of interest is from the given landmark
